fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-149].
  {panel}

Currently when you have a parent issue that contains sub-task, when you import into JIRA Portfolio as backlog it won't show the estimates for the sub-task by itself.

*Example:*
# Create a parent issue in JIRA
# Set time tracking on this parent issue (estimate and remaining)
# Create a sub-task issue under this parent issue
# Import into JIRA Portfolio
# The estimate column for sub-task will not display under the backlog/plan view of JIRA Portfolio, nor will be considered when reporting.
fields.summary: sub-task inheritance on estimates when import as backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-293].
  {panel}

If stories do not have any linked issues, it will not counts in Epic progress bar.

For example, see this:
!xyz.png|thumbnail!

In the attached screenshot the progress of "Epic 01" should include the progress of both "Story 01" (86%) and "Story 02" (0 %).

But the progress of "Story 02" is not included because it is not linked with a JIRA issue.

It will be great to include unlinked issues in Epic progress bar.
fields.summary: Unlinked issues should include in Epic progress bar
Move child issues from one parent to another via drag and drop
Group the graphical schedule view by initiatives or themes
As a project manager I should be able to see the dependencies between jira issues, critical path schedules, timeline, progress indicator, scheduling error all in one view
Reopening closed linked Jira issue does't reopen Portfolio epic
Mixed Methodologies Plan - Story Points + Hours/Days
Budget Resource Allocation by expense type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-342].
  {panel}

JIRA Portfolio imports Epic Summary, but then synchronizes back by over-writing into Epic Name. Synchronization would import and update, back and forth, to and from the same field. It should not change what field it imports from and updates to.

*Current behavior*
JIRA Portfolio displays the JIRA Epic Summary as the JIRA Portfolio Title when synchronizing

*Requested behavior*
JIRA Portfolio displays the JIRA Epic summary as the JIRA Portfolio title when synchronizing
fields.summary: Update how JIRA synchronizes Epics so the Portfolio Title becomes the Jira Epic Name
issue Key is not updated when issue changes project key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-421].
  {panel}

I want to be able to define a set of rules to assign default estimates based on work item properties.
E.g. : add one story point on stage "Accessibility Testing" if:
* the work item has a certain theme, or
* the work item title contains a certain keyword, or
* the linked JIRA issue has a certain custom field.
fields.summary: Add default estimates in JPO based on work item properties
Provide i18n support
Allow non-agile teams to better configure JIRA Portfolio scheduling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-450].
  {panel}

Within JIRA Portfolio Epics can be associated with an Initiative.

You can also create JIRA issues linked to the Initiatives within Portfolio.

The Epics in Portfolio can also be associated with JIRA issues of type Epic.

When you link a JIRA issue with an Initiative this should create a link between the Issue and the Epic JIRA issues which implement that Initiative.

For example

* Initiative = Mars Mission (JIRA issue SPACE-100) -- is implemented by
** Epic = Space Craft Build (JIRA issue SPACE-200)
** Epic = Catering (JIRA issue SPACE-250)
 
If you open up issue SPACE-100 you would see an issue link pointing at SPACE-200 and SPACE-250 and the corresponding counter-links would appear on those issues as well.

This will increase the traceability and visibility of the Initiatives and also allow JQL queries to be constructed which can then be used in regular JIRA issue navigator based reporting. For example -- something like:

{noformat}
issuetype = Initiative AND summary = "Mars Mission" AND status NOT IN (Resolved, Closed) AND NOT (issueFunction IN linkedIssuesOf("status != Closed", "implements")
{noformat}

Would show you all of the outstanding Epics required to implement the Mars Mission initiative.
fields.summary: JIRA issues associated with Initiatives should link to the implementing Epics
Import releases from custom field
Grouping of Streams
Show calculated start and end dates in the backlog table
Filter the graphical schedule by a date range

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-364].
  {panel}

With our implementation of the portfolio and Jira Agile we have created a particular mapping between estimates on custom sub tasks to the estimates on the 'skills' in the portfolio. Note we are using time to estimate effort. For example we have custom sub tasks 'Design', 'Development' & 'Testing' that link to skills of the same name in the portfolio. 

Once a portfolio epic becomes 'live' we would like to link an actual epic in Jira with which then aggregate sum of the relevant sub task types would flow back into the portfolio 'skill' estimates in the portfolio. Effectively the ownership of the estimates now moves to the implementation of the epic in Jira. This now gives us a 'live' constraint based view of the skill estimates as they vary during the implementation phase, eg the test estimate doubles and the test skill become a visual bottle neck in the portfolio. We are often coupled to skill shortages in our workflow, etc.

In the current portfolio documentation there is a suggestion to use the story breakdown to create a separate story for each skill and just use title string to describe. We could do this but we find this data model less obvious than using specific sub task types for the skills. Also a single story neatly contains all the effort estimation in this model, avoiding a proliferation of stories under an epic. I should note also we like the portfolio be a lean with just epics that link to the Jira epic and avoid duplicating too much data, the drill down is always possible with the issue link.

So the question is would this 'sub task type' to 'skill' mapping be something worth considering in the portfolio product when setting up synchronization?

If not it would be great to have a basic API on the portfolio to allow us to scripts this custom synchronization we desire properly. At the moment we actually have this working with some custom scripting that interacts with the Jira API and SQL db for the portfolio (gasp), updates once a day. This was really just our proof of concept ;)
fields.summary: Portfolio Plan Update use case?
Highlight unestimated underlying issues
Introduce Bottlenecks for Releases
Combine Stages Option for Stories View in Project Timeline

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-220].
  {panel}

Identify and flag gaps between release end and next release start when start is dynamically scheduled

Scenario:
* The first release has a fixed end date. Subsequent releases have dynamically scheduled start dates and fixed end dates.
* When the start dates are dynamically scheduled there may be a gap between the previous release end and the start of the next release. 
** The start of the subsequent releases is based on the finish date of the release and how many sprints it will take to complete the release. 
** The start does not necessarily come immediately after the end of the previous release, potentially leaving a gap of one or more days. 

It would be good if JIRA Portfolio could identify gaps between the fixed end date of one release and the dynamic start date of the subsequent release so that I may choose to address these gaps or ignore them.
* A possible solution would be adding a small indicator type icon next to the date, indicating a gap is present.
fields.summary: Identify and flag gaps between release end and next release start when start is dynamically scheduled
Milestones

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-113].
  {panel}

Use case: 

I have several items on the backlog which I want to manage and keep, but not yet schedule until they are ready for development. 
Currently, as soon as an item has estimates, a team gets assigned automatically - it is not possible to NOT assign a team or exclude items from the schedule. 

Solution idea: 
Move ideas through some sort of staging workflow, from the rough idea until its ready for dev.
Allow to use it for what-if scenarios ("what if we wanted to pick up this idea") but allow to exclude from schedule until a certain stage of the workflow is reached.
fields.summary: Support "staging" of work until it is ready to be planned
New Epics/Stories should not be automatically assigned to a Stream
As a project manager I want to add/edit/remove absences to an entire Team or even Plan
Option to merge Plans
Convert Virtual Users to Actual Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-452].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*
Users shouldn't be shown inactive/disabled users when adding team members or resource allocations. 
Might want to also check any other spots where inactive users can be selected.

*Expected Result:*
Only active users are in the drop down list

*Current Result:*
All users, including inactive users are listed in the drop down list.

*Workaround:*
*For Portfolio Cloud:*
Revoke *Application Access* for inactive users and this should make sure that they are no longer in the drop down list for users. (!)_This workaround does not work in JIRA Cloud {{7.0.0-OD-02}}_
fields.summary: Inactive users selectable for Teams and Resources
Allow attachments for portfolio entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-314].
  {panel}

I want to be able to import all new stories from JIRA whose parent Epic is already in Portfolio.

My situation:
- I have a lot of stuff in JIRA that I don't want imported into Portfolio
- In JIRA Portfolio, I onlynwant to track a specific set of Epics and all their child Stories (i.e. the ones the business cares about most, and where resourcing matters most)
- Over time, as requirements evolve, new Stories are created in JIRA, and unless I can import these the plan will be wrong

The problem:
- When I go to import issues, I only want to see the ones that belong to an already imported Epic.
- There is no filter I can write that will select only those issues whose parent is already imported in JIRA Portfolio.
fields.summary: Ability to import only issues whose Epic is in Portfolio already
When searching for an existing issue, it should not be necessary to provide project
Display Completed Epics on the Reports Release Page
Synchronize the Earliest Start with a field in JIRA
Date picker - start week on Monday
Import existing issues should provide same basic filters as Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-114].
  {panel}

Requirement: 
In addition to being able to define a static number of weekly hours in a timeframe that a member is available to certain teams, there should be a possibility to allocate people dynamically between teams based on the priority of items in the backlog and where the skills are mostly needed. 

Possible solution approach: 
1) Introduce a field of total weekly hours for a person (not per-team but on the person as an entity)
2) On the weekly hours field, be able to switch between static and dynamic. Static does the same the current implementation, i.e., allowing to specify weekly hours statically allocated to this team in a certain timeframe, dynamic means that the person can be allocated up to the total available time to a team, but across all teams not more than the total weekly hours. Additionally, it should be possible to specify a range, e.g. "can be allocated up to 50% of her time to this team"
The scheduling algorithm, when scheduling by priority order, allocates these flexible capacities greedily to the most important items, i.e. to get something with high priority done first, the according team will get the person allocated by as much as possible. 
This means, people could switch from sprint to sprint flexibly between teams, in Kanban mode even from day to day, working for team A on one day, and team B on another day.
fields.summary: Dynamic switching/allocation of people between multiple teams
Import/Export just for Teams
Add components  to backlog
Manage for a team member the general availability like the team availability
Schedule a story in JIRA Portfolio
Issues in Iniative issue link
Requesting capability to have stories with different stages and skills.
better description for scheduling maximum resources
Default estimate for Stories
Releases as Fix Versions
As a project manager I want to plan a stream with Start Date and End Date
Stories overlap of one member can overlap in Kanban mode
Add an inline comments field to backlog
Color code the list items rows by category
Automatic creation of issuetype Initiative

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-38].
  {panel}

We have a lot of different stories in an epic.
Some stories are simple and need only on stage, others are difficult and Need some stages ans skills.

Actually I always have to use many different Groups containing same People and have only one Stage assigned.

This is high effort and blowing up the Group Management Function.

Setting up Stages and Skills by Story Type and assigning a Story Type to a Story would solve this Problem.

Rg. Sascha
fields.summary: Stages and Skill depanding on Story Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-10].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

At the moment, sprints scheduled in Portfolio and Agile aren't aligned. Options to keep them synchronised (manually or automatically) would allow the users to fully utilise both add-ons and increase the clarity with regard to data displayed in different parts of JIRA.
fields.summary: Keep Sprints in sync with JIRA Agile
Synchronize JIRA user name changes back to JIRA Portfolio
Time writing should be done as in JIRA
Improve "Update from date" performance

Please allow the import of dependencies to other issues.

E.g. a depencie is given in a JIRA issue by setting a link from one issue to an other, using the link type "depending on". By importing the issue into JIRA Portfolio, the linked issue should be set as "required" in JIRA Portfolio.

This way all relevant information can be set by the assignee in the JIRA issue (estimation, dependencies).

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-69].
  {panel}

Currently, it is only possible to share any roadmap with a defined group of people. In a larger company, we want to give everyone access to follow product planning and progress in development, but then everyone could (accidently) change priorities or other values.

Please create at least two general access levels:
* read
* write (i.e. create / edit / run operations such as re-calculations)
fields.summary: Differentiate read / write access to portfolio

* I have an epic with two stories in JIRA
* I import this epic and its stories to Portfolio
* I create another epic in JIRA
* I move one of the two stories of the first epic to the new epic
* I want this change to modify my Epic/Story relationship in Portfolio in order to be in sync with my configuration in JIRA
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio to adapt to changes made to Epic/Story relationships in JIRA

*Expected:*

All stories without any estimates for a given stage (all 0 / empty) should not be created

*Actually*

Stories are created for stages where there are no estimates 

Example: 

The stage "amaze" do not have any estimates, and because no action is needed for any tickets in that stage for the current project - thus we don't want them to be created as empty shells

- http://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/monosnaps/_CW_DEMO_-_JIRA_Portfolio_-_JIRA_2015-05-29_15-51-35.jpg

- http://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/monosnaps/_CW_DEMO_-_JIRA_Portfolio_-_JIRA_2015-05-29_15-51-54.jpg

A bonus would be, that you could also export on stage+skill :)

Define story point supply per resource

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-20].

It would be great if we had an interactive Story Map view of Epics and Stories that would enable us to visually order the Epics and Stories for a Stream.

For more info Story Mapping see the following links:

http://www.agileproductdesign.com/writing/how_you_slice_it.pdf
http://www.agileproductdesign.com/blog/the_new_backlog.html
fields.summary: Story Mapping view
Allow hiding of estimate sums

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-409].
  {panel}

Having a scrum team and calculating with story points I want to be able to define a story point supply for every resource.
Currently JPO only supports the velocity definition for the whole team.

h2. *Workaround:*
You can adjust weekly hours as a proxy to reflect story points per team member.
The proportion of weekly hours per team member equates to the proportion of story points assigned to members from the pool of team points.

*E.g: Team X has 30 pts*
Case 1:
Member A - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts
Member B - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts
Member C - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts

Case 2:
Member A - 60 weekly hrs = 15 pts
Member B - 40 weekly hrs = 10 pts
Member C - 20 weekly hrs = 5 pts
fields.summary: Define story point supply per resource
As an admin, I'd like to be able to restrict the number of team members available per Epic
As a project manager I want to see the dependencies between Initiatives, Epics and Stories in a gantt like graph.
Allow orthogonal Themes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-310].
  {panel}

*Scenario* : 
When one user is allocated to multiple projects/sprints at the same time (full time), then JIRA Portfolio does not give any indication of that to the administrator. It is possible to plan a user in multiple projects at the same time without getting any warning.

*Suggestion* : 
When you add a user to a team, Portfolio should indicate available hours based on the team members allocation to other teams. There should also be a way to clearly view the users allocation in all the other teams.

If a user is allocated for 40 hours in 2 teams, then there should be a warning message to make the user aware of this situation. To further add on, it would be best if we could have the visibility the total number of hours available for the team to ease on the scheduling and planning as well.
fields.summary: Clear visibility of available hours per team member
Sprint Start/End Dates
Possibility to set an issue reporter upon issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-247].
  {panel}

*Summary*
At the moment, sysadmins/admins cannot see a private plan unless they have been explicitly granted access. It would be desirable that admins have access to all plans.

*Use case*
This is to allow sysadmins/admins to see Private Plans for cleaning up purpose, for example when the said use has left the company.
fields.summary: Allow sysadmin/admin to access private plans
Assign more than one initiative to a team in parallel
Deletion of linked Epic/Story in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-341].
  {panel}

Currently, if there are too many epics in the backlog sometime it is difficult for them to identify these items, it would be best if we had an option to to define the colors for each epic separately, based on the team allocated or derived from the respective initiative.

As an administrator, I think it would be valuable to be able to color code initiatives and epics, as it would make it easier to locate specific epics when there are quite a few in a plan. A few examples of how we could customise the color are:

To be able to set or select a colour to represent Initiatives and Epics.
When an Initiative colour is set, apply that colour by default to the Epics in the Initiative.
Sync the colours between Portfolio and JIRA.
fields.summary: Define custom colors for epics and initiatives

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-218].
  {panel}

Theme Target should not be automatically adjusted to add up to 100% as this is usually not correct and users are almost unable to readjust them.

Suggestion is to let users set targets manually and:
# notify them if the aggregate is not 100%
# give them a button that will automatically adjust the targets when clicked on
fields.summary: Better handling Theme Target settings
Stage and skill percentage based on team
Allow users to prevent blocked dependent issues from been assigned
Multi Select for Managing Backlog in Portfolio
As an project manager I want stories under an epic in the backlog to be "epic linked" with that epic.
Option to display issue status in "Update plan from date..." dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-398].
  {panel}

Hi

I am helping with setup of Portfolio for my business unit. We have a lot of teams with various skills, and we often get assigned tasks that will only fit into the skill set of a few persons on a specific team. 

An example: A task (epic) has been assigned to my team. I have linked the epic to my backlog and estimated it to 10 days. The task only targets Skill 1 in our cross-functional team:
!1.png|thumbnail!

We have 5 skills, and skill 1 is, by default, set to 20%. I now want to make skill 1 accountable for 100%. You cannot punch in '100%', so I enter '100':
!2.png|thumbnail!

But now the full estimate is 100 days. Of course, I could the just enter 10, but that still interferes with the idea of making Portfolio driven by the data in the backlog.

Would it be possible to allow for entering percentages in the skill fields? However, I am not sure if this is the best solution for the problem. If I have a task with 70% Skill 1 and 30% Skill 2, it would be possible to slot it in using the idea above. But as time progresses and, say, the Skill 1 part estimate increase due to whatever, this will also affect the percentage of the estimate that goes to Skill 2.
fields.summary: Stages and percentages
